UI_visible_response: Read 94 web pagesView Page DetailsIt is difficult to provide an exact number of people who have died from pollution in China, as pollution-related deaths are often estimated based on various studies and models. However, according to a study published in 2025, about 230,000 individuals died prematurely in China due to PM2.5 pollution. Another study estimated that PM2.5 pollution caused 1.77 million premature deaths in China in 2019. The World Health Organization also states that about 2 million people die each year in China because of air pollution.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: It is difficult to provide an exact number of people who have died from pollution in China, as pollution-related deaths are often estimated based on various studies and models. However, according to a study published in 2025, about 230,000 individuals died prematurely in China due to PM2.5 pollution[^2^]. Another study estimated that PM2.5 pollution caused 1.77 million premature deaths in China in 2019[^5^]. The World Health Organization also states that about 2 million people die each year in China because of air pollution[^6^].
